repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: A collection of correspondence; government documents, including reports, commissions, decrees, legal proceedings, account books, treasury records, petitions, geographic relations and awards; church documents; writings and poems; and published illustrated materials from the Andean region of Latin America (Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Venezuela) on civil, military, economic, religious, and social topics.

langmaterial.language: The collection is in Spanish, English, and German.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials have been assembled from various collections and acquired from several individuals. They include materials transferred from the Latin American Collection Curator, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Series Part I, Part II, and Oversize are available on microfilm. Patrons must use FILM HM 247 instead of the originals.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Andean Collection (MS 1775). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Series Part I, Part II, and Oversize are available on microfilm and may be purchased from Gale Group, Farmington Hills, Michigan.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in three parts and four additions. Materials in each part are arranged alphabetically by country, and by date within country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence; government documents, including reports, commissions, decrees, legal proceedings, account books, treasury records, petitions, geographic relations and awards; church documents; writings and poems; and published illustrated materials from the Andean region of Latin America (Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Venezuela) on civil, military, economic, religious, and social topics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part I is 8.5 linear feet; the majority is comprised of both originals and copies of Peruvian materials. They include manuscripts and printed works which can be used to study the history of Peru from the prehispanic period to the middle of the nineteenth century. The materials document the cultural history of the Andean people before the Spanish conquest; colonial civil administration; the role of the Catholic church in colonial society; the Bourbon reforms; the war of Independence; the anarchy of the early republican period; and the war of the Confederation Peru-Bolivia.

On the history of the Andean people before the Spanish conquest, Part I includes copies, complete and partial, of various accounts written by chroniclers in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries. There are texts by the chroniclers Juan de Polo de Ondegardo, Juan de Santa Cruz Pachacuti, Antonio de la Calancha and Fernando de Montesinos.

The materials related to the colonial period are numerous and varied, and document the central area of the Peruvian viceroyalty (currently Peru and Bolivia) and its other areas such as Quito, New Granada, Chile and Rio de la Plata. To study the colonial civil administration during the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries, the reports written by the viceroys are valuable sources. There are also account books and legal writs which can be used to analyze the economic and political role of the Church in the colonial milieu, in particular the role of the Jesuit and the Mercedarian orders. The Bourbon reforms which took place in the Peruvian viceroyalty are especially well-documented in the numerous royal and viceregal decrees, issued mostly in the second half of the eighteenth century.

Concerning the war of Independence period, there are letters, reports and administrative texts by prominent personages such as Simón Bolívar, José de San Martín, Juan de Berindoaga and Antonio José de Sucre. The turbulent initial years of the republican period can be reconstructed from the correspondence by generals Agustín Gamarra and Antonio Gutiérrez de la Fuente. Finally, there are several letters and military reports on the war of the Confederation Peru-Bolivia, an ambitious political plan to create a union between the two countries led by the General Andrés de Santa Cruz.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: These materials available on microfilm. Patrons must use FILM HM 247 instead of the originals.

did.unittitle: Código fiscal del estado de Cundinamarca. .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Incomplete manuscript. Contain regulations on state income, taxes, salaries of state employees, budget, inspection of local administration, etc.

did.unittitle: Lei reformando la de demarcación I división territorial del estado.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Law issued by the Asamblea Constituyente del Estado de Cundinamarca reforming the territorial limits of the state.

did.unittitle: Constitución política del estado de Cundinamarca.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original document signed by members of the Asamblea Constituyente del Estado de Cundinamarca.

did.unittitle: Código de Fomento redactado por Pastor Ospina I presentado a la Asamblea Constituyente del estado de Cundinamarca por la Comisión Codificadora.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two manuscript documents: original Código, and revision, to promote the economic and cultural development of the State of Cundinamarca based on legal regulations for traffic, transportation, commerce and industry.

did.unittitle: Proyecto de Código penal del estado de Cundinamarca.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Defines offenses against religion, state administration, civil rights, public health, moral, public and individual property, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains typed letters, notes of a trip up the Amazon in 1896, and clippings of articles on Ecuador published in American and European newspapers.

did.unittitle: Libro antiguo de algunos intrumentos y de la obligación de misas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents concerning chaplaincies established at the convent of La Merced in Lima in the sixteenth century. Some refer to the conquerors Francisco Pizarro, Martín de Ampuero and Hernando de Montenegro [exceptional collection for reconstructing the economic history of the Mercedarian order].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents concerning the services of members of the Aratia family to the Spanish crown during the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries. With these documents, the Aratia probably expected to sustain their claims of privileges from the crown. Includes copies and originals of royal decrees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of an account of the history, religion and economy of the Inca state. The original (1571) is preserved at the National Library in Madrid.

did.unittitle: "Libro de Su Magestad yntitulado común del año de 1572."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of Miguel Sánchez, official of the Royal Treasury in Cuzco, of the state incomes from fines, tithes, etc. Includes information on the tribute paid by Indians of encomienda.

did.unittitle: "Libro de los remates de tributos de los repartimientos de Cuzco, 1575-1582."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of the sale of products paid in tribute by Indians. Products include clothing, cattle, maize, potatoes, fish, wheat, etc.

did.unittitle: "Libro de acuerdo de los oficiales reales del Cuzco."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains agreements reached by the officials of the Royal Treasury concerning salaries, loans to the Crown, appointments of officials, Indian tributes, alms to the Church, etc.

did.unittitle: Account book of the Royal Treasury of Cuzco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed accounts of the officials Gregorio López de Unçueta and Antonio Rodríguez concerning Indian tribute to the Spanish Crown.

did.unittitle: Documents on the hacienda Piccho, Cuzco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typed copy of a document which summarizes the history of ownership of the hacienda from 1579 to 1788.

did.unittitle: "Tralado [sic] de un cartapacio a manera de borrador que quedó en los papeles del lizenciado Polo de Ondegardo cerca de el linaje de los Ingas y cómo conquistaron."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account of the history of the Inca which includes information on military expansion, economy, society, religion, administration, etc. The last part of the text consists of notes based on the Royal Commentaries by the chronicler Garcilaso de la Vega. Polo's work is a nineteenth century copy of the original (from the sixteenth century) preserved at the National Library in Madrid.

did.unittitle: "Traslado de un cartapacio a manera de borrador que quedó en los papeles de el licenciado Polo de Ondegardo cerca de el linaje de los Yngas y cómo conquistaron."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy, identical to previous entry, but does not include Royal Commentaries . NOT FILMED.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A baptized curaca of the Cuzco region, Santa Cruz wrote this account of Incan history from a Christian perspective. This is a copy of the original (sixteenth century) preserved at the National Library in Madrid.

did.unittitle: "Discurso sobre la descendencia y govierno de los Yncas."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of an account of the history of the Incas of Cuzco from Manco Capac to Manco Inca. The original (1608) is preserved at the National Library in Madrid.

did.unittitle: "Están aquí tres privilegios de iuro y renta dados por el excelentísimo señor marqués de Montesclaros, virrey, governador y capitán general del Perú...sobre su real hacienda y rentas destos reinos en favor de Antonio Correa...." Los Reyes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three documents granting rents from the Royal Treasury to Antonio Correa. They include copies of royal decrees issued by the King of Spain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of a letter by the General of the Order to the Dominican Luis Cornejo. And a royal decree by the King to the Marquis of Guadalcázar, viceroy of Peru, regarding the celebration of the provincial chapter in Lima.

did.unittitle: Letter from the King of Spain to Pedro de Perea, bishop of Arequipa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contemporary copy, in which the monarch asks the Prelate to have good relations with members of the cathedral chapter of Arequipa.

did.unittitle: "Señor. Un libelo infamatorio se ha impreso..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A printed text written in defense of the administration of Joan de Licerazu, president of the Royal Audiencia of Charcas.

did.unittitle: Documents re: the inspection, by Bernardino de Prado Beltrán de Guevara, judge of the Royal Audiencia of Santa Fe, New Granada, of the administration of the city of Cartagena.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of six royal decrees with instructions for the inspection; three documents on the excommunication issued against Prado by the vicar general; one letter by the Inquisitor of Cartagena on ecclesiastical immunity; and two letters by the President of the Royal Audiencia of Santa Fe to the Inquisitor and the Bishop of Cartagena. Also includes: Motivos que tuvo el señor licenciado don Bernardino de Prado... contra el maese de campo don Melchor de Aguilera, governador y capitán general de la provincia de Cartagena.

did.unittitle: Documents re: inspection, by Juan de Palacios, of the Royal Audiencia of La Plata.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of two documents: a letter by Gabriel de Ocaña y Alarcón, and a royal decree, giving instructions about how to conduct the inspection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of six chapters, of the work originally published in 1653, which describe the religious rites practiced by the Indians in the area of Copacabana, near Lake Titicaca. Includes an English translation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of expenses of the Jesuit College of San Pablo in Lima. Includes detailed data on salaries paid to musicians, physicians, merchants, workers; money invested in construction; acquisition of clothing, etc.

did.unittitle: "Libro de cédulas, autos acordados y otros ynstrumentos pertenecientes a los yndios. Año 1760."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains numerous copies of royal, viceregal and Royal Audiencia decrees on tribute, labor, administration of justice, and indoctrination of Indians; and civil and ecclesiastical administration and economy of the Peruvian viceroyalty.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Navarra y Rocafull, Melchor de, duke of La Palata

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An extensive and detailed report on the administration of the Duke of La Palata, who was viceroy of Peru in the second half of the seventeenth century. Includes information on ecclesiastical, economic, cultural, military and political affairs.

did.unittitle: "Diente del Parnaso que trata dibersas materias contra médicos, versos amorosos, a lo divino, pinturas y retratos."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of compositions in verse. Most are satires on physicians and citizens of Lima, and others are poems on religious subjects.

did.unittitle: "Libro primero de las memorias antiguas historiales del Perú."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of thirty two chapters of the work originally written at the beginning of the seventeenth century and preserved at the Royal Academy of History in Madrid. Montensinos argues that Peru was Ophir, the kingdom described in the Holy Scriptures and visited by the navy of King Solomon.

did.unittitle: "Libro segundo de las memorias antiguas historiales del Perú."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of twenty eight chapters from the second part of Montesinos' work, which describes the history of the Incas who ruled Cuzco.

did.unittitle: "Libro segundo de las memorias antiguas historiales del Perú."
"Book second of the ancient historical records of Peru, by the Licenciate Fernando de Montesinos."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: English translation of previous two entries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of Montesinos' chronological history of Peru from1498 to 1547, originally written at the beginning of the seventeenth century. Describes events from Columbus' third trip to America to the period of the rebellion of encomenderos in Peru.

did.unittitle: Silva fúnebre que hiço el insigne y real convento de Lima de el orden de Nuestra Señora de La Merced...a la cathólica y real magestad de nuestro rey I señor Philippo Quarto el Grande."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of poems written for the funeral ceremony in memory of King Philip IV, held at the church of La Merced in Lima, on 27 November 1666. Includes compositions by Sebastián de Almoguera (who compiled the volume) and other members of the Mercedarian order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gaspar de Barahona asks for grace (merced) from the viceroy of Peru. To support his request, Barahona narrates in great detail the services to the crown provided by his grandfather Juan de la Hoz and his father-in-law Pedro de Guevara, during the conquest and civil wars in Peru.

did.unittitle: "Libro de las alajas desta santa yglecia de San Pedro, Lurín."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Different inventories and accounts, made between 1712 and 1746, of church holdings. The inventories list paintings, furniture, parochial books, sculptures and sacred vestments.

did.unittitle: Book of royal and viceregal decrees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of numerous copies of decrees issued by the kings of Spain and the Peruvian viceroys in the eighteenth century, regarding the royal treasury, ecclesiastical councils, commerce, administration of justice, state bureaucracy, taxation, and the Inquisition. Includes a very detailed report, dated 1768, on the royal treasury offices in the Peruvian viceroyalty; and a "Diálogo entre un español y un americano. Se trata de las riquezas de oro y plata que ha tenido España y de las que se extraen en estos reinos del Perú; y se exponen los medios para facilitar su mayor opulencia."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a royal decree addressed to the Royal Audiencia of Santiago de Chile, dated 30 April 1723, concerning the concession of encomiendas in that jurisdiction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of an extensive account of the political turmoil during the administration of Josef de Antequera y Castro, governor of Paraguay. Includes a detailed description of the economic and religious activities of the Jesuits in Paraguay, considered by the author as the promoters of the political problems in that region. The copy comes from an original preserved at the Archive of the Inquisition in Lima. The report is the one referred to in the previous entry; whether it is the copy that was sent with the letter is unknown.

did.unittitle: Letter by the Lima Inquisitors to the General Inquisitor of Spain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a letter, in which they refer the King to a report written by MathÃ­as Angles y Gortari, corregidor of Potosi, on the political situation in Paraguay during the administration of Josef de Antequera y Castro, governor of that province. The letter also refers to the murder of Antequera on the day of his scheduled public execution in the main plaza in Lima.

did.unittitle: "Manifiesto hecho a la Santa Inquisición de la ciudad de Lima sobre asumptos de los padres de la Compañía en la provincia de el Paraguay."

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This is a copy, bound as a volume.

did.unittitle: "Respuesta de un devoto del orden seráfico a la carta informe del Marqués de Castel-Fuerte, virrey del Perú."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed defense of Franciscans friars accused of participating in a plan to liberate Josef Antequera on the day of his public execution.

did.unittitle: Report on the viceroyalty of New Granada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Extensive report on the natural resources and products of the region of New Granada.

did.unittitle: "Noticias del estado de la provincia del Paraguay."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed copies of letters by the Jesuit Jerónimo Herrán and the Viceroy Castel-Fuerte on the revolt of the Comuneros of Paraguay in 1732.

did.unittitle: Relación succinta de lo acontecido en Lima el día 23 de diciembre de 1736 en el auto general del Santo Tribunal de la Inquisición.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account of the trial of the Jesuit Francisco de Ulloa, accused of heresy by the Peruvian Holy Office in 1736. Probably written by a Jesuit, the text intends to exculpate Ulloa by describing the irregularities in his judicial proceeding.

did.unittitle: "Ynforme y proiectos que paso a ejecutar..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of different plans for promoting mining, extraction of pearls, navigation along the Atrato river, and commerce and military defense in the viceroyalty of New Granada. These documents were to serve as guides for the government of that viceroyalty, reestablished in 1738.

did.unittitle: "Proyecto istructibo [sic] para reparar el evidente peligro a que están expuestas las tres provincias de Buenos Ayres, Tucumán y Paraguay."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Plan to reinforce Spanish colonization in the area of RÃ­o de La Plata, consisting of the construction of a road from Jujuy to Asunción, promotion of navigation along the RÃ­o Grande or Bermejo, and recuperation of the territories occupied by Portuguese.

did.unittitle: Report on the frontiers of Spanish territory in South America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An extensive report proposing to develop new settlements and military defenses along the Spanish frontier with the Portuguese territory in South America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Endnotes to the decrees issued by the Lima Provincial Councils held in the sixteenth century. Some notes reproduce royal decrees. A signature on the first page indicates that this manuscript belonged to Manuel de Odriozola, a nineteenth Peruvian historian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a decree addressed to the viceroy of Peru, issued on 19 February 1761, informing the new administrative organization about the Juzgado de Media Annata y Lanzas.

did.unittitle: "Relación que escrive el Conde de Superunda, virrey de el Perú, de los principales sucesos de su govierno."

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Manso de Velasco, José Antonio, count of Superunda

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report of the administration of the Count of Superunda, who was viceroy of Peru between 1745 and 1761. Includes tables of the Indian population in the different bishoprics, of the rents of the Royal Treasury offices, and of military supplies in Lima and Callao.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of a decree addressed to the viceroy of Peru, issued on 28 January 1763, concerning the payment of 6% state debts.

did.unittitle: "Relación descriptiva de la ciudad y provincia de Trujillo del Perú."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of fragments of the first and third chapters, of the work printed in 1763, which describe the history of Trujillo valley. Includes an English translation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Decree addressed to the viceroy of Peru concerning the administration of incomes from the payment of Lanzas and Medias Annatas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Decree addressed to the viceroy of Peru on the duties and privileges of Nicolás de Salazar, alguacil mayor of the Royal Treausury in Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two copies of a decree, issued on 15 May 1766, concerning the salary of members of the Royal Audiencia and Royal Treasury. One of the copies includes a viceregal decree issued by Manuel de Amat, viceroy of Peru, ordering that copies of the royal decree be sent to the Royal Treasury offices in Lima, Potosi and Charcas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two copies of a decree addressed to the viceroy of Peru, issued on 12 March 1768, regarding the remittance of gold and silver to Spain. One copy is incomplete.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed decree regulating the incorporation of clergymen in the cathedral chapters of America and Philippines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a decree addressed to the viceroy of Peru, issued on 15 December 1768, concerning the administration of tithes by the officials of the Royal Treasury.

did.unittitle: Documents on Colonel Francisco Joseph de Mesa y Ponte, marquis of Casa Hermosa, corregidor of the province of Huaylas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mesa y Aponte asks the viceroy to pay the fianza, from his appointment as corregidor of the province of Huaylas, to the Royal Treasury of Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a decree addressed to the viceroy of Peru, issued on 4 June 1769, regarding the collection of taxes from commerce.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed decree on the establishment of the Renta Vitalicia, a state-managed company with stock holders. Includes regulations for the management of the company.

did.unittitle: "Real cédula de su magestad y señores del Consejo...por la qual se declaran libres de alcabalas y cientos las ventas que se están haciendo de los bienes raíces ocupados a los regulares de la Compañía."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed decree establishing no taxation on the sale of real property belonging to the Society of Jesus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a decree addressed to the viceroy of Peru, issued on 23 January 1770, related to the military budget of Panama.

did.unittitle: "Real cédula de su magestad en que aprueba y confirma, a representación del... virey don Manuel de Amat y Juniet, las providencias que este expidió, así para la puntual satisfacción de synodos a los curas del distrito."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed royal decree addressed to Manuel de Amat y Juniet, viceroy of Peru, issued on 6 March 1770, confirming the dispositions given by him for payment of salaries to rural priests. Includes Amat's original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Decree addressed to the officials of the Royal Treasury in Lima approving the confiscation of merchandise not registered at the port of Mancora.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Viceregal decree, issued on 17 July 1770, giving instructions on payments to be made to military officers and soldiers of the army.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Decree addressed to the officials of the Royal Treasury in Lima approving the confiscation of merchandise from the ship Nuestra Señora de la Soledad in the port of Paita, for improper registration.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Viceregal decree addressed to the officials of the Royal Treasury in Lima ordering them to help the royal officials at the port of Callao.

did.unittitle: "Instrucción metódica expedida por este superior gobierno del Perú para que sirva de regla a los jueces de revisita en el distrito de este vireynato."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed instructions by Juan Josef de Leuro y Carpfanger on the procedures to be followed by state inspectors in taking the census of tax payer Indians. Includes an order by viceroy Manuel de Amat y Juniet, issued on 24 July 1770, approving the instructions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed decree by Viceroy Manuel de Amat y Juniet, issued on 7 November 1770, prohibiting notaries from providing testimonies without a judicial order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Decree addressed to the officials of the Royal Treasury in Lima to deduct 135 reales de vellón from Lieutenant Estanislao Ruiz de Cabrejas's salary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed decree by Viceroy Manuel de Amat y Juniet allowing members of municipal councils to acquire properties which belonged to the Society of Jesus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a decree, issued on 16 February 1771, concerning taxes to be paid on the money sent to Spain by Chilean merchants. Includes viceregal orders related to the royal decree.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a decree, issued on 18 March 1771, concerning the administration of Miguel Antonio Calderón de la Torre, the alcabala tax collector. The tax was assessed on buying and selling cattle in Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed decree ordering not to charge the 18% fee for salable public posts/positions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Decree addressed to the officials of the Royal Treasury in Lima to deduct 19 pesos monthly from Lieutenant Antonio Zini's salary.

did.unittitle: "Libro mayor que comprehende por menor todas las partidas de entrada y salida universal de los diferentes ramos de que se compone el jiro circular de negociaciones resultantes de las temporalidades ocupadas de orden de su magestad a los regulares que se denominaban de la Compañía de Jesús."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of the Junta de Temporalidades concerning the administration of rural and urban properties which formerly belonged to the Society of Jesus in Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed decree concerning the intervention of non Spaniards in the commerce between Spain and its American colonies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed decree which grants new privileges to the CompañÃ­a del asiento de negros.

did.unittitle: "Quejas de un sincero amante de el rey nuestro y zeloso del honor de sus compatriotas dirigidas al padre venerable provincial de los ministros agonizantes establecidos en esta ciudad de Lima."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter addressed to Father Francisco González Laguna, provincial of the Buenamuerte order, in which Heras comments on a text, written by Father Duran and dedicated by González Laguna to the viceroy, concerning the ecclesiastical policy of the Spanish Crown.

did.unittitle: "Carta del cura de Condorillo a un amigo convaleciente en la Cieneguilla sobre la que escribió un chararero al provincial de la Buenamuerte."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Pombo, José Ignacio and Martín Melgar

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains several texts on natural resources, particularly botanical, in the Peruvian viceroyalty. Some of the texts have authorship. The volume includes "Dase noticia de las riquezas que encierra en sÃ­ los reynos del Perú...;" "Riquezas de oro, plata y otras varias de la provincia de Quito;" "Noticias varias sobre las quinas oficinales, sus especies, virtudes, usos, comercio, acopios y su descripción botánica" by José Ignacio Pombo (this text is illustrated with watercolor drawings of the quina plant); "Plantas del Perú por sus nombres vulgares determinados a géneros botánicos;" "Noticias que da de esta ciudad de San Luis de Loyola y su jurisdicción don Juan de Videla;" and "Virtudes de las plantas del Perú" by MartÃ­n Melgar.

did.unittitle: "Pueblo de Late y de la Rinconada".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Document on the dispute between the Indian communities of Late and La Rinconada and landowners for possession of lands in Lima valley.

did.unittitle: "Unas cartas relativas al licenciado don Fernando de Montesinos."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of correspondence of Friar Josef de San Antonio Abad with José de Gálvez and Juan Bautista Muñoz. Concerns the transcription that Friar José de San Antonio Abad was making, between 1785 and 1786, of "Anales del Perú"and "Memorias antiguas historiales del Perú," both works by Fernando de Montesinos, a seventeenth century historian. Also includes a biographical note on Montesinos and a summary of the content of "Memorias antiguas historiales del Perú."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a report written by Juan Pino Manrique to Francisco de Paula Sanz, dated 16 June 1786, concerning the plan for the establishment of the Tribunal de Mineria in Potosi. This is a nineteenth century copy from the original preserved at the Royal Academy of History in Madrid.

did.unittitle: "Informe sobre la formación del Tribunal de Minería."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a report by Juan Pino Manrique, dated 7 September 1787, concerning the establishment of a Tribunal de MinerÃ­a in Potosi. This is a nineteenth century copy from the original preserved at the Royal Academy of History in Madrid.

did.unittitle: Guía histórico, geográfico, físico, político, civil, legal del govierno e yntendencia de la provincia de Potosí."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account of the history, mining production and industry, geography and economy of Potosi.

did.unittitle: "Estado actual del catholicismo, política y economía de los naturales del Perú y medios de corregirlo."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A member of the enlightened elite bureaucracy, Cebrián wrote this plan to reform Indian society in order to facilitate its more effective incorporation into the colonial system.

did.unittitle: "Libro de extractos de los títulos pertenecientes a las fincas que obtubieron los regulares extinguidos de esta ciudad del Cuzco, año 1788."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents on the haciendas which belonged to the Society of Jesus in Cuzco. Contains information to reconstruct the history of the ownership of the haciendas from the sixteenth to the eighteenth centuries.

did.unittitle: "Prontuario práctico, mecánico y económico o ynstrucción compendiosa...de la real casa de la moneda de Santiago de Chile."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed report on the offices, machinery, and operation of the mint in Santiago de Chile.

did.unittitle: "Relación que hace el excelentísimo señor don Theodoro de Croix, virrey que fue estos reinos del Perú y Chile a su succesor el excelentísimo señor frei don Francisco Gil de Lemos, desde 4 de abril de 1784 hasta 25 de marzo de 1790."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Extensive report on the administration of Teodoro de Croix, viceroy of Peru. Contains data on ecclesiastical, political, economic and military affairs. Although his name is not mentioned, it is well known that Hipólito Unanue, a leading figure of the Lima intellectual elite, was the author of Croix's report.

did.unittitle: "Informe sobre el plan y de un socabón."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Plan for the construction of a tunnel to extract water from the Potosi mines. A nineteenth century copy from the original, dated 5 July 1790, preserved at the Royal Academy of History in Madrid.

did.unittitle: "Visita a las minas e ingenios del Cerro-Rico."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report on the mining industry in Potosi. A nineteenth century copy from the original, dated 30 July 1790, preserved at the Royal Academy of History in Madrid.

did.unittitle: "Abatido estado de las minas del Perú."

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Franco, Dionisio, count of San Isidro

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Extensive report by Dionisio Franco, count of San Isidro, to Diego Gardoqui, concerning the mining industry in Peru. As member of the Tribunal de MinerÃ­a in Peru, Franco describes the causes of the crisis in mining in the Peruvian viceroyalty and proposes a plan to improve production. A nineteenth century copy of the original, dated 1 May 1794, preserved at the Royal Academy of History in Madrid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report by Tadeo Hanke to Francisco de Viedma, governor of Cochabamba, dated 20 April 20 1799, on the geography of the Peruvian viceroyalty. Includes a list of astronomical instruments requested by Haenke for his geographical work. A nineteenth century copy from the original preserved at the British Museum in London.

did.unittitle: "Yndignación a la carta del señor Ynspector general escrita sobre las operaciones militares contra los rebeldes y sobre el despueblo de Puno y su retirada al Cuzco."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dialogue of four characters on the rebellion of Tupac Amaru in 1780. The aim of this dialogue, as the author states in the introduction, is to defend the military performance of Captain José del Valle, general inspector of the viceregal army, during the rebellion of Tupac Amaru.

did.unittitle: Description of the viceroyalty of Peru.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports on the corregimientos existing in the archbishops of Lima, Trujillo, Huamanga, Cuzco, Arequipa, La Plata, La Paz, Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Tucuman and Paraguay. Contains information on geography, production and natural resources.

did.unittitle: "Manifiesto de los agravios, bexaciones y molestias que padecen los indios del reyno del Perú."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed report on the grievances made by corregidores and rural priests against Indians in the viceroyalty of Peru. Signed by Vicente Mora Chimo, representative of the Indians of Peru.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed form to be used by the ships Nuestra Senora del Consejo and San Fermin for their navigation to Cadiz. The form is blank.

did.unittitle: "Cuenta y razón puntual de las entradas y gastos que tienen estas oficinas de fielatura."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of the Lima mint from the years 1800 to 1804.

did.unittitle: "Libro principal respectivo al establecimiento de la nueva Hermandad de la Santísima Trinidad Jesús Sacramentado y Purísima Concepción en la yglesia del Oratorio de los padres de San Felipe Neri de esta ciudad de Lima, que dio principio en el año de 1809."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Book of the confraternity founded at the church of San Pedro and Pablo in Lima. Contains the rules of the confraternity, lists of its members, agreements, and a calendar of religious festivities. The title page is decorated with a watercolor drawing which depicts an allegorical religious scene.

did.unittitle: Decree by the Council of Regency.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a decree by the Council of Regency to the viceroy of Peru, issued on 1 April 1811, concerning the administration of the Junta de Temporalidades.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The author compiled travel notes (written by others) on the geography and natural resources of the regions Lima, Cajatambo, Huaylas, Tarma, Ica, Yauyos and Cuzco. The description of Lima contains references to prehispanic ruins. Apparently these notes were to be used in writing a major work on the geography of the Peruvian viceroyalty. This is a nineteenth century copy from an original, dated 1814, preserved at the British Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed decree by the King and addressed to the viceroy of Peru, which reestablishes the Society of Jesus in the territories of the Spanish monarchy. This is a Lima reproduction of the decree issued originally on 11 June 1816.

did.unittitle: Documents on the Junta de Temporalidades.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents written by the general administrator and employees of the Junta de Temporalidades. They detail the administrative problems the Junta faced in executing the royal decree which reestablished the Society of Jesus in the Peruvian viceroyalty.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter by José Ramón Rodil to the Intendant Manuel de la Fuente concerning military officers.

did.unittitle: Appointment paper of a military officer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed document specifying Miguel Terrazas as sergeant-major of the Lima Dragons of Lima.

did.unittitle: Anales de la ciudad de Potosí.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chronological history of the city of Potosi from the prehispanic period to 1802. Contains data to document events of the urban history of that mining city. Includes a composition in verse "Testamento y última voluntad de la fidelÃ­sima villa imperial de PotosÃ­ en quartetas dedicado en décimas por la misma villa a su actual governador intendente señor don Francisco de Paula Sanz."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed decree issued by José de San MartÃ­n which names Antonio de Albalobo as lieutenant-second of the battalion of Cazadores del Perú. Signed by San MartÃ­n.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter by Bernardo de O'Higgins to José de San MartÃ­n, in which O'Higgins states that Manuel Blanco has received a new post in the army.

did.unittitle: Documents re:/by Antonio José de Sucre.

scopecontent.p: Includes letters and reports concerning the military campaign for Independence.

did.unittitle: Documentos on Francisco de la Sal y Rozas.

scopecontent.p: Documents related to the legal proceedings of Francisco de la Sal y Rozas to recover his properties confiscated during the war of Independence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal letter discussing politics. Signed by AgustÃ­n [AgustÃ­n Gamarra?].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter by Juan de Berindoaga to Antonio Gutiérrez de la Fuente concerning the death sentence decree issued by Simon BolÃ­var for José de la Riva-Agüero and his followers.

scopecontent.p: Documents concerning the loan granted by Chile to Peru during the war of Independence.

did.unittitle: Letters by José de la Mar.

scopecontent.p: Three letters by José de la Mar, president of Peru, concerning political and military affairs.

scopecontent.p: Copy of the proclamation, issued on 4 January 1825, by royalist general Olañeta to his army.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter by royalist General José de Carratalá to the prefect of Arequipa asking assistance for his return to Spain.

Contains thirty nine letters by Antonio Gutierrez de la Fuente to AgustÃ­n Gamarra, and one letter by Andrés Garrido to Gutiérrez de la Fuente.

Contains: a proclamation by Salaverry to the Arequipa population; a letter by Salaverry to General Andrés de Santa Cruz; a letter by Salaverry to his wife Juana Flores, written shortly before his death; and a letter by Juana Flores addressed apparently to the Arequipa authorities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter by M.Ros to Domingo Tristán announcing that the Supreme Dictator has granted Tristán an extension of his military service in the south of Peru.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pencil and watercolor drawings of precolumbian pottery from Peru, Mexico, and New Granada. The illustrations of Peruvian pottery are the most numerous and depict pieces from the collection of Leonce Angrand, preserved at the Museum of Louvre, in Paris, and other private collections.

did.unittitle: "Nota de los manuscritos relativos al Perú que se hallan en la Biblioteca Nacional de Madrid."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: List of various manuscripts and printed books on Peru, from the sixteenth to the eighteenth century, in the National Library in Madrid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A legal interpretation of the proceedings in the case of Manuel de Castro y Padilla, oidor of the Royal Audiencia of Lima, who wanted to get married in that jurisdiction. This text, probably written in the early seventeenth century, contains many references to legal treatises considered important by colonial lawyers.

did.unittitle: "Indice de las bulas y monitorios que ay en el archivo del Perú."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of transcriptions and summaries of different Papacy bulls, royal decrees and other documents (some in Spanish, some in Latin) granting ecclesiastical privileges to the Society of Jesus in Peru. An important source for the study of Jesuit practices of indoctrination in colonial society. Includes two texts by Juan Pérez de Menacho, a famous Jesuit theologian of the first half of the seventeenth century. The collection comes from the archive of the College of San Pablo in Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dialogue of two characters, Astrea and VerÃ­dico, on the religious controversy between Father Marimón and the members of the Buenamuerte order, which took place in Lima in the late eighteenth century. A manuscript note states that the text was denounced and submitted by Friar Francisco González Laguna, provincial of the Buenamuerte order, for censorship. Apparently this is a contemporary copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a text entitled "ArtÃ­culo XX. De ynscripciones, medallas, edificios, templos, antigüedades y monumentos," in which the author studies the use and meaning of stones with inscriptions, and medals, among Andean prehispanic societies. The author also analyses religious architecture. This is a nineteenth century copy, probably of part of a major work on the history of Prehispanic cultures in Peru.

did.unittitle: Documents on captaincy of Felipe Esteves.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reports, letters and certificates related to the naval career (1812-1848) of Felipe Esteves. Includes an extensive and detailed summary, dated 15 June 1849 in Caracas, on the performance of Esteves as an officer from 1810 to 1841.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of the political constitution of the Venezuela state, originally printed in Angostura in 1819. Establishes civil rights, territorial limits, the internal organization of the legislative, executive and judicial powers, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part II is 5.75 linear feet, and contains original texts and copies of documents from the Andean nations of South America. While Peruvian materials make up the majority of the collection, there are also items from Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador and Venezuela. The materials trace the history of the Andean region from the early years of Spanish conquest to the later national period (1544-1926). The collection is particularly strong for the eighteenth and early nineteenth centuries and consists of official state documents such as royal decrees, legal proceedings, reports, account books, treasury records, petitions and geographic relations; church documents; ecclesiastical texts; correspondence; accounts of events; political writings; poetry; scrapbooks; and photographs.

The collection lends itself to a myriad of research topics for the colonial period, including pre-Colombian civilizations; regional history; civil administration; the role of the church in colonial society; the Bourbon reforms; and the colonial mining industry. For the study of pre-Colombian cultures, a text by the Jesuit, Antonio Julian, offers detailed descriptions of the "demonic" religious practices of the native peoples, and argues the Spanish conquest did not have a negative impact on the indigenous inhabitants.

Regional/micro history is documented in two detailed eighteenth century "relaciones geograficas" (geographic relations) describing the Caupolican and Apolobamba regions of modern Bolivia and the Abancay area of Peru, and in an interesting report describing the types of trees found in the Partido of Conchucos (Tarma) and their uses. There is an outstanding description of Lima, written by an unknown author, which includes graphic descriptions of the city's racial groups, social customs, and pastimes, and an 1812 census of Callao, which provides demographic details about household size and composition, as well as occupational data. A 1698 text details the damages suffered from an earthquake in the towns of Latacunga, Riobamba and Ambato, Ecuador. There is also very interesting documentation of a lawsuit by Alvaro Medaña over the ownership of the ship Nuestra Señora de la Candelaria , which contains details of voyages in the South Seas made by this discoverer of the Solomon Islands.

Colonial civil administration can be traced through a "relación" (report) on the state of the Kingdom of Peru, prepared for the viceroy in 1667. A number of royal decrees demonstrate the Spanish state's increasing need for revenues, and document the other concerns of the Spanish monarchy during the first half of the eighteenth century. Treasury records include account books from Cuzco (1572-1573) and Cuenca (1783-1827); detailed statements of the Viceroyalty of Peru's income and expenditures for 1787 and 1788; and a chart made in 1797 listing employees of the viceroyalty with salaries greater than four hundred pesos. A series of acts of the Lima cabildo and its successor, the ayuntamiento constitutional, present information about municipal administration. Rebellion against civil administration can be studied through copies of texts about an encomienda belonging to Juan de Espinosa that also deal with the Gonzaro Pizarro revolt (1544-1548). There are several documents related to the Tupac Amaru Rebellion, in particular, a text authored by José Raphael Sauaraura provides a first hand account of the rebellion and offers a defense of the bishop of Cuzco during the revolt.

The integral role played by the Catholic Church in colonial life is well documented. The various manifestations of this centrality can be traced through documents dealing with the Jesuit order's right to establish a residence for their order in Huancavelica; texts relating to a dispute over the control of the Indian "doctrina" of Ayabaca; materials from litigation between two religious orders to force interest payments on the principal of a loan imposed on an Ecuadorian hacienda; an opinion concerning the establishment of a convent of nuns governed under the rules of poverty of Saint Clare; papers relating to the Hospital of San Lazaro in Lima, which contain the statutes of the related cofradia (lay religious brotherhood); and documents from a lawsuit filed by members of the Augustinian order to remove their provincial from his office

The "Bourbon reforms" aimed to bring about the economic, social, political and military modernization of Spain and its colonies. Useful manuscripts concern institutions that arose out of Bourbon reforms. These include one relating to the Peruvian economic society, the Sociedad de Amantes del Pais, and another dealing with establishment of the Colegio de Abogados de Lima (the Lima law school.) The military aspects of the Bourbon reforms can be studied through documents relating to attempts to create a new militia company in Tarma, Peru, and a defensive plan for Lima and Callao prepared in 1807. A text dealing with the planting of trees in Huamanga demonstrates the increased influence of European ideas on the thinking of this era.

The mining industry provided much of the wealth of the Spanish empire. Texts on the mining enterprise include a copy of a report by Diego Calderón y Salcedo on the discovery and problems of the Potosí mines; a copy of an appeal to the king from the guild of "azogueros" concerning production costs; a text by Francisco Serra y Canals explaining the practices of the silver mining industry and a hand drawn plan of the Huancavelica mercury mine.

The collection also contains a wide variety of documentation from the various Andean nations related to the independence period. Materials from Colombia include a letter written by Antonio José de Sucre to Manuela Esteva concerning the Battle of Ayacucho; a letter by the ardent royalist, Manuel Urrutia, describing conditions after Simón Bolívar's victory at Boyacá; and an account by Elias Prieto Villate presenting participant and eyewitness recollections of the Battles of Vargas and Boyacá. Documents from a trial related to an 1809 uprising in Quito describe the beginnings of the independence movement in Ecuador. The movement in Peru can be studied from texts concerning a new exaction of Indian tribute (1812-1813), a principal cause of a rebellion in highland Peru that is viewed as a precursor to the independence movements led by José de San Martín and Bolívar. The records of a junta of notables outline their determination of the best means to pay for increased defensive costs owing to the movement. The Peruvian perspective on Bolívar's rule, immediately after independence, is documented in an essay, and in extracts from newspapers and correspondence (1826-1827). From Venezuela, a document signed by Simón Bolívar urges British officials not to intervene in Spain's disputes with its Latin American colonies. Correspondence of Bolívar and a letter by Manuel Urdañeta discuss the military situation and battles of the Venezuelan independence movement.

Items in the collection sometimes span the independence period and the early national period. Examples of this include the Francisco Ribas correspondence, which consists of letters by a number of independence leaders, written between 1818 and 1854, discussing political, personal, military and other matters. A scrapbook of South American letters and other documents collected by, and bound for, Isabel Alderson, a member of a leading English merchant family residing in Caracas in the eighteenth century, contains similar correspondence and some handwritten observations concerning the authors of the letters.

The materials for the study of the later national period are limited, but of some interest. The Ripart-Montclar correspondence contains a series of detailed, personal letters, written by the French chargé d'affaires in Lima, to his sister between 1869 and 1871. These letters document a critical period in Peruvian history between the decline of that nation's guano boom and the War of the Pacific, and contain Ripart-Montclar's personal opinions and insights about Peruvian society. The correspondence also contains many references to the political unrest in France, as well as the Franco-Prussian War. Also of interest is a photo album from the 1920s that presents a number of images showing the conditions of the Venezuelan oil fields during the years the industry developed and contributed to the economic development of the modern nation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: These materials available on microfilm. Patrons must use FILM HM 247 instead of the originals.

did.unittitle: "Suceso portentoso acaecido en el asiento mineral de Porco distrito de Potosí."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of a document describing the appearance of a comet on 1553 Jan 13. The top half of the page is a painting of the described event.

did.unittitle: Title: "Por parte de Gil de Carvajal...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Legal brief in a case dealing with the office of "receptor de peñas del cámara del PotosÃ­" and a sum of pesos paid for the position. Some of the text is in Latin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Response to the aforementioned legal brief. Some passages are in Latin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief letter by [Gra?] de León Holgado seeking payment from an unidentified party.

did.unittitle: "Relación del descubrimiento de la mina del Cero de Potosí."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten copy of a report to the king of Spain, by a silver refiner, concerning the discovery and history of the PotosÃ­ silver mines. The text discusses production methods and problems facing the mining industry, especially those relating to the water supply. The writer also seeks compensation for the loss of his refinery.

did.unittitle: "Memorial por parte de Antonio Goncález del Pino...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Legal brief presented by Antonio Goncález del Pino, on behalf of Ana Ortis de Benabente, in a dispute over a black slave named MarÃ­a Malenba.

did.unittitle: Appeal to the king of Spain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten copy of a report in which the procurador sindÃ­co of the guild of azogueros tries to prove to the king that royal officials are misleading him about the costs of the silver production. Included are detailed calculations by the procurador of the actual production costs faced by azogueros.

did.unittitle: "Que la donación de Alonso Quadrado no pueda presumirse simulada o hecha en confianca."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Legal documents concerning the donation of the estate of Alonso Quadrado to the Jesuit order.

did.unittitle: Petition from the "Fiscal Protector General." Places: [La Plata?], Potosí, Charcas, Lima, [Madrid?].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Petition seeking royal action to stop the payment of "curatas" to the archbishop of Lima. The appeal resulted from a vacancy in the parish of Concepción in the city of PotosÃ­.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Decree by the king of Spain concerning procedures for the conduct of the "residencias" of deceased royal officials.

did.unittitle: "Relación histórica, geográfica que yo D. José de Santa Cruz Villavizencio...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed report describing the Caupolican and Apolobamba regions of northwestern Bolivia. The region's governing subdelegado authored the account. Included are descriptions of the native peoples, their customs, crops, and trade. Also discussed are topics such as quality of lands; transportation facilities; weather; mines; flora and fauna; and the settlements and missions found in the region. A regional census is included in the text.

did.unittitle: "Relación histórica, geográfica que yo D. José de Santa Cruz Villavizencio...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy, identical to previous entry. NOT FILMED.

did.unittitle: "Tratado del beneficio de metales de plata por amalgamación según se practica en América."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: [Original?] Handwritten volume dealing with the practices of the silver mining industry, written in the form of a dialogue. The book contains eight plates documenting the techniques and machinery used in the production of silver.

did.unittitle: Letter by Andrés de Santa Cruz to Mr. Cerruti.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten letter by a leader of the South American independence movements stating he is about to leave for the (northern provinces of South America?). Text is accompanied by a typescript English summary.

did.unittitle: Index of documents related to mining.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten list in English and Spanish of documents related to the mining industry in Bolivia, Peru, and other parts of colonial Latin America (possibly held by the British Museum.),

did.unittitle: "Relasión de los compañías de batallón de Ynfantría destinado para refuerzo de la Plaza de Valdivia con distinción de los oficiales que deben cubrirlas."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief list of infantry companies and their officers being sent to southern Chile. Also included are the military service records of four individuals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief letter by José Miguel Carrera, a leader of Chilean independence, concerning Bishop Diego Antonio Navarro MartÃ­n de Villodres's library.

did.unittitle: "Préstamo hecho a Chile de un millór de pesos."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first portion of the text provides details about a loan Chile took out in London. The second section deals with loans to Colombia made in Europe. The final part contains Spanish translations of articles from United States newspapers mainly concerning Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief order from the king of Spain to the governor of Cartagena, to provide handwritten testimony before a notary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal letter from Pedro de Quesada Toledo y Benebides to the Marquesa [-----?] de Aguilar concerning his marriage.

did.unittitle: "Monarquía del diablo en la gentilidad del Nuevo Mundo...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten text by a member of the Jesuit order arguing that Latin America's pre-Colombian civilizations were under the dominion of the devil and that the Spanish conquest did not have a negative impact on the native American peoples. The text contains descriptions of the indigenous people's religious practices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A small group of documents from the State of Cartagena, including vouchers, a drawing of the flag, and a list of officials and their salaries.

did.unittitle: Letter by Manuel Mariano Urrutia to Toribio Montes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter by an ardent royalist to the former military commander of Quito. The text describes the military, political, and human situation in Quito, and southwestern Colombia, following Simón BolÃ­var's victory at Boyacá.

did.unittitle: "Reglamento de comercio para el istmo de Panama...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rules governing trade in the ports of the Panamanian isthmus. The code concentrates on imports and exports, but also lays out rules for internal commerce with the other parts of Colombia.

did.unittitle: Letters by Antonio José de Sucre.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two letters written by the South American independence leader to Manuela Estevez. The second letter, dated 1825, discusses the victory over the Spanish at the Battle of Ayacucho.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of correspondence describing the seizure of two Colombian merchant ships by the Spanish navy. A prisoner exchange is also discussed.

did.unittitle: "Batallas de Vargas I Boyacá 25 de julio de 1819 = 7 agosto de 1819."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed handwritten text describing events before and after the battles of Vargas and Boyacá, focusing on the military situation. The text is based on participant and eyewitness accounts, and includes two illustrations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published letter signed by "el Doctor Ribas," to an unidentified person, dealing with the affairs of the Quito audiencia. [The author may be Francisco Rivas, one of the first three members of the Quito audiencia.]

did.unittitle: "Relación de los estragos que ha causado en esta provincia el terremoto...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A series of three reports detailing the destruction caused by the earthquake of June 20, 1698, in Hambato, Latacunga, the villa of Riobamba, and the pueblo of Patate.

did.unittitle: "Sobre acción real de P. Fr. Manuel de Villalva."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lawsuit brought by friar Manuel Villalva of the Order of Predicadores of Latacunga. The legal action sought to force the "regulares del nombre de Jesús" to pay interest on the principal of a loan imposed on the hacienda Pitula.

did.unittitle: "Libro de quentas con la caja real de Truxillo."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of payments made by the royal treasury of Cuenca to the royal treasury of Trujillo, later the national treasury of [Gran Colombia?]. Included are records for the payment of the tithe, "novenos," and "vacantes mayores."

did.unittitle: "Vista fiscal en la causa de la rebolución de Quito...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Legal document dealing with charges against the leaders of the August 10, 1809 independence movement.

did.unittitle: Miguel Moreno y Morán papers. Places: Guayaquil, Guatemala, Andalusia, Valencia, Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professional and personal correspondence (incoming and outgoing) of Miguel Moreno y Morán. Included are letters from his father, Manuel Ignacio Moreno, and his uncle, José Ignacio Moreno, and messages that mention Miguel's appointment to the Guatemalan audiencia. Also found are legal documents which include Moreno y Morán's designation as a Guayaquil delegate to the [Spanish?] Cortés.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief handwritten letter of thanks from Ignacio de Veintemilla to D. S. Reimberg. The text is accompanied by notes in English about Veintemilla.

did.unittitle: Pleito de Juan de Espinosa. Places: Cuzco, Los Reyes, Quito and La Plata.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bound copies of texts dealing with an encomienda belonging to Juan de Espinosa and concerning whether he participated in the Gonzalo Pizarro revolt. Featured throughout are the names of many people important in early Peruvian colonial history including: Gonzalo Pizarro, Governor CristÃ"bal Vaca de Castro, Viceroy Blasco Nuñez de Vela, Pedro de la Gasca, Alonso Alvarado, Lorenzo de Aldana, Francisco Carvajal, Francisco Pizzaro and Diego Almagro. The texts conclude with a lengthy series of interrogatories in which a number of witnesses for de Espinosa defend his loyalty to the Spanish crown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten copy of a report by Viceroy Francisco Toledo, to King Philip II, concerning the Spanish attack on Vilcabamba, the last center of Incan resistance.

did.unittitle: "Libro de sumas para el thesorero Miguel Sánchez deste año de mil quinientos de setenta y dos años."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Account book of Miguel Sanchez, an official of the royal treasury in Cuzco, detailing state incomes from tithes, silver taxes, fines, ecclesiastical fees and other revenue sources. Also included is information on Indian tributes.

did.unittitle: "Libro de sumas para el thesorero Miguel Sánchez deste año de mil quinientos de setenta y dos años."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy, identical to previous entry. NOT FILMED.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lawsuit by Alvaro de Mendaña against Francisco Lorenzo and Marcos Pérez concerning the ship Nuestra Señora de la Candelaria. Mendaña discovered the Solomon Islands. The text contains interesting information about Mendaña's voyages in the Pacific. [Portions of the text are badly decayed.]

did.unittitle: "Sobre las tierras de Guaillapampa y Yanapampa en Chetilla."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents concerning farm and ranch lands belonging to the Indians of the "pueblo viejo de San Estevan de Chetilla."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Petition by Viceroy Fernando de Torres y Portugal concerning the failure of royal officials in parts of Peru and Bolivia to charge Indian tributes designated to pay militia salaries.

did.unittitle: "Don Fernando de Torres y Portugal, Conde de Villar...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Document from the viceroy of Peru dealing with a request for Indian labor from the Jesuit colegio of Arequipa.

did.unittitle: Interrogatories. Places: Los Reyes and San Miguel de Piura.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents dealing with a dispute over the "doctrina" of the Indian village of Ayabaca. The majority of the text consists of questions asked of witnesses appearing on behalf of the convent of Nuestra Señora de la Merced in Piura.

did.unittitle: Personal letter to Luis de Medina.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter to Luis de Medina from (his brother?) Miguel. In the text Miguel discusses his marriage, family, property, and other matters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Incomplete document that appears to a testimony concerning litigation over a debt in the multi-generational Salcedo family. Testimony lays out the Salcedo family lineage and is concerned whether some of the men were married and of noble descent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuel Bautista Pérez, the son of Portuguese parents, presents evidence to the Peruvian audiencia that he is a Spanish citizen, and has the right to reside in Peru.

did.unittitle: "Provisión de licensia para tener casa de residencia...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of documents dealing with the Jesuit order's right to establish a "casa de residencia" for their members in Guancabelica.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two handwritten copies of a report to the king mainly concerning the use of mercury in the mining industry. The copies were made in the early twentieth century. [The original documents may be in the British Museum.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Legal documents relating to the estate of Gaspar de Silba, an inhabitant of the "villa de Guaura," who died in Piura. Included are the deceased's will and an inventory of his property.

did.unittitle: Relación del estado del reyno de Peru.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed report on the state of affairs in the Kingdom of Peru prepared for the viceroy. The report is divided into four parts: the royal treasury, secular government, ecclesiastical government, and events subsequent to the report's closure date.

did.unittitle: "Sylva funebre a las honras del excelentissimo señor..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Funeral poetry composed in honor of Francisco Fernández de la Cueva, the duke of Albuquerque. [This poetry may have been read at a memorial service in deceased's honor.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief listing of adjustments to royal treasury accounts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Document dealing with fees owed by officials of PotosÃ­'s Casa de Moneda.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten bound volume of poetry, by an unidentified author, dealing with events and people in late seventeenth century Peru.

did.unittitle: "Traslado del parecer e informe que hizo el Pe. Nicolás de Olea...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Opinion given by Father Olea concerning a petition made by two nuns to found a convent, governed by the rules of poverty of St. Clare.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed account of the arrival of two French ships off the western coast of South America. The French king empowered the ships to attack pirates. The report describes the actions of the ships in Chilean and Peruvian ports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unidentified Latin religious text by an unknown author [dealing with the beatitudes?].
