scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents describing a supposed/threatened Indian rebellion which include testimonies given by three merchants about background events, and a discussion of the "repartimiento de mercancÃ­as" by corregidores as a cause of Indian unrest. Passages in the texts cite plans to kill Spaniards; mention a descendant of "the Inca;" and refer to plans to restore Indian domination "in these kingdoms" in the year of the three sevens (1777). There is also a detailed table listing charges corregidors in Peru were permitted to make for the repartimiento [de mercancias?] in various jurisdictions over a five year period; alcabala charges on these sales; and the annual salaries of corregidors.

did.unittitle: "Real decreto en que S.M. ha resuelto ampliar la concesión de comercio libre...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed royal decree extending "comercio libre" within the empire to Buenos Aires, the interior of South America, and "legal" ports in Chile and Peru.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed royal decree of the schedule of fees that a notary could charge for ships' manifests and other services for "comercio libre" with Spain and inter-colonial trade.

did.unittitle: "La verdad desnuda sobre el homicidio del Coronel don Antonio de Arriaga...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A text detailing the dispute between Miguel de Arriaga, corregidor of Tinta (who was murdered in the Tupac Amaru Rebellion) and the bishop of Cuzco. The text is written by "an impartial lay religious of Cuzco," but consists almost entirely of two "representations" made by Arriaga's brother and nephew.

did.unittitle: Three letters concerning the Tupac Amaru Rebellion. Places: Cuzco, Asangaro and Arequipa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first letter is from General José del Valle to Diego CristÃ"bal Tupac Amaru, the half brother of José Gabriel Tupac Amaru, concerning a grant of amnesty. The second letter is Diego CristÃ"bal Tupac Amaru's defiant response to del Valle's letter. The third letter is directed to the ecclesiastical cabildo of Arequipa concerning the revolt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report about the city of Lima by an unidentified author. Included are descriptions of the city's climate, lands, the types of crops grown, as well as regional flora and fauna. The report also describes the architecture and physical layout of the city. The text includes vivid commentaries about different racial groups, dress, social customs, and diversions.

did.unittitle: "Estado del Peru piedad de su exelencia defensa de príncipe lealtad de la América al real trono de España."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A defense of the conduct of the bishop of Cuzco during the Tupac Amaru Rebellion. The text is a first person narrative about the rebellion.

did.unittitle: "Reglamento que deberá obserbar y cuidar de su obcerbancia en los artículos que comprehende el M. Y. Cabildo de la ciudad de Lima."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series of regulations for the conduct of city business and legal cases by members of the Lima cabildo. Also included are rules for notaries, as well as ordinances related to the cabildo's role in commerce and the provision of basic staples.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brief letter to the viceroy of Peru from José de Gálvez concerning the suspension of the shipment of dictionaries and catechisms in Indian languages.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Royal approval sent to Lima's "real junta de temporalidades" placing the church and colegio "Casa Profesa de los Desamparados" under the control of the congregation of Saint Philip of Neri.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documentation that The Convent of Santa Catalina provided 25,000 pesos to Dr. Diego Orbea in exchange for mortgages (and annual interest payments) on his farms and two houses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two detailed statements covering the income and expenses of the royal treasury of the Viceroyalty of Peru for the years 1787-1788.

did.unittitle: "Plan que demuestra la superficie de la real mina de azogues de S.M. del cerro de Santa Bárbara de Huancavelica...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handdrawn painted plan of the surface area of the Huancavelica mercury mine.

did.unittitle: Document related to the auction of a house. Places: Callao and Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Appeal from a priest seeking recognition of a mortgage on a house belonging to Manuela Prieto, that was being sold at auction.

did.unittitle: Report on the woods of the Partido of Conchucos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed report on the types of trees that grow in and around Tarma and their uses.

did.unittitle: Documents concerning the Sociedad de Amantes del País.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two documents related to the Sociedad de Amantes del PaÃ­s. The first contains the printed statutes of the society, a list of the society's publications in various fields, and a membership roster. The second is a handwritten document which contains the statutes of the society and copies of official decrees related to the society.

did.unittitle: "Plan de valance corte y tanteo de la moneda fysyca y alajas de plata y oro en especye pertenecyentes a las temporalidades del reyno de Peru...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed statement of the income and expenses of the "junta de temporalidades" for the year 1795.

did.unittitle: Expediente promovido por el señor governador intendente don Ramón de Urrutia sobre creación de otro regimento de milicia en aquella provincia. Places: Tarma and Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series of documents related to the militia companies of Tarma. The provincial intendent seeks to create a new militia regiment. Included is a census of the Tarma district and surrounding villages.

did.unittitle: "Estado general de los empleados en este virreynato, que siendo de absoluta nominación de S.M. por llegar y exceder sus sueldos de la suma de 400 pesos...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Multi-page chart listing officials of the Viceroyalty of Peru with an annual salary greater than 400 pesos, who received interim appointments from the viceroy. Each entry includes the official's name, his position, annual salary, date of appointment, and name of the viceroy who made the appointment, and whether each individual had received royal confirmation.

did.unittitle: Adicción al capítulo 17 del libro 2? de 2? parte de los Comentarios Reales del Peru de Garcilaso de la Vega.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photostatic copy of a handwritten text, said to be an addition to chapter seventeen of book two of Garcilaso de la Vega's Comentarios Reales. The text contains footnotes referring to Mercurio Peruano, a periodical not published until the 1790s, long after the publication of Garcilaso's epic work. The text is accompanied by a typescript English translation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Part of a text dealing with Lima's San Lazaro church and hospital. The text includes records of [ecclesiastical?] cabildos, relating to the hospital; a list of the hospital's income (renta); and a list of statutes (constituciÃ"n) of the cofradÃ­a of San Lazaro, a lay religious brotherhood connected to the church and hospital. [Portions of the cofradia's statutes appear to be missing].

did.unittitle: Descripción de la provincia de Abancay.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report about the province of Abancay, located west of Cuzco. Included is information concerning population, land, crops and livestock, transportation infrastructure, and physical geography. [The report appears to be missing text related to the province's villages.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: José Bernardo de Tagle y Portocarrero acknowledges a debt of 20,000 pesos to the "compañÃ­a de los cinco gremios de Madrid," and the two men who held the company's power of attorney in Lima.

did.unittitle: "Copia de una carta escrita por el Dr. dn. Vicente Morales contra dn. Gazpar Rico."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The director of the compañÃ­a de los cinco gremios de Madrid presents two letters outlining financial irregularites perpetrated against the company by Gaspar Rico, as part of a lawsuit before the "tribunal del consuldo."

did.unittitle: "Expediente que promuebe el señor presidente del reino de Chile sobre que se auxilie la remision de quinientos qqs. De salitre libres de derechos que el administrador de minería de aquel reyno tiene tratados con don José Gambini vecino de esta capital para la fábrica de polvora de mina."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Extended legal proceedings to allow José Gambini, a Lima merchant, to extract and ship 500 quintals of potassium nitrate from Lambayeque, Peru, to Chile for the manufacture of gun powder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten diatribe addressed to individuals opposed to the planting of trees in the center of the city. The author defends the action by stating the public plaza had been a festering garbage dump for 300 years. The writer also defends the planting of trees in public places by noting it is a common practice in Europe.

did.unittitle: Plan de defensa de la ciudad de Lima, plaza del Callo y su campaña.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Defensive plan for the city of Lima and the port of Callao. The plan contains listings of forces needed by the forts of Callao and the city of Lima, as well as a roster of the general staff and responsibilities of different officers. Also included are three drawings of plans for two warehouses and defensive improvements to the home of the governor of HuarochirÃ­, along with a statement of the projected construction costs.

did.unittitle: Estatutos para el gobierno y dirección del ilustre colegio de abogados de la ciudad de Lima formados con areglo a la real cedúla de su erección dada en Madrid a 31 de julio de 1804.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten copy of the published statutes governing the "colegio de abogados" of Lima. The statutes cover organization, membership, meeting procedures and ceremonies.

did.unittitle: "Compulsa de los auto seguidos por don Francisco José de Argote y don Ventura Martínez contra don José Gorrichategui por cantidad de pesos."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Certified copy of legal proceedings that Francisco José Argote and Ventura MartÃ­nez pursued against José Gorrichategui over debts for merchandise Gorrichategui purchased in Panama. José Antonio del Valle, a priest, also claims Gorrichategui owes him money.

did.unittitle: Libro de actas del cabildo del Lima y ayuntamiento constitucional de Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Book of acts by the Lima city council. (The body was first called the cabildo and after 1810, was known as the ayuntamiento constitucional). Many of the acts certify the merits and services of military men, royal functionaries, and religious officials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten copy, made in Peru, of a royal decree by the regency council creating a new military order, "the Cruz Nacional de San Fernando," to reward distinguished military service. The order contains the articles or statutes governing the new award.

did.unittitle: "Don José Vello, ayudante mayor del real de esta capital, padrino de Eusebio Mosquera; en la causa seguida contra él, y otros por la subverciÓn que se dice trataban espone en cumplimiento de su deber lo siguiente."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: José Vella, ayudante real mayor of Lima, offers a defense of his godson, Eusebio Mosquera, who had been charged with subversion [for participating in a military revolt?].

did.unittitle: "Lista de la compañía de cargadores del puerto del Callao compuesta de 50 hombres pardos, quarterones y morenos libres...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: List of officers and soldiers of Callao's mixed race "cargadores" militia company. The list includes each man's marital status and place of residence.

did.unittitle: Padrón del pueblo del Callao y del de Pitipiti...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed census of Callao and Pitipiti. Each entry gives the name and age of every member of a household, the person's occupation, marital status, and place of birth. The census also details where members of all households not present for the census were at that time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Listing of certain royal cedúlas dealing with the actions and privileges of the Lima cabildo, issued by the king between 1790 and 1808, and the Supreme Council of the Regency between 1808 and 1811.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thirteen documents discussing whether Peru's Indians should pay a new tribute exaction, as a voluntary contribution to the state. Some of the documents are addressed to the viceroy, some are by various officials of the royal treasury, and others are by officials in outlying areas. One of the letters is signed by Mateo GarcÃ­a Pumacahua, the president of the Cuzco audiencia and hereditary cacique, who led a revolt in 1814.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous volume/copybook containing [original?] poetry and copies of two wills, royal documents related to the "gremio de doncellas, and "the bando a las chuchumecas." The author/owner of the book is unknown.

did.unittitle: "Reglamento para la real Universidad de San Marcos."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series of thirty five statutes to reform education at the University of San Marcos in Lima. [Probably enacted because forbidden subjects such as popular sovereignty and the natural rights of men were taught there.]

did.unittitle: Expediente de los padres difinidores de nuestro padre San Agustín contra su provincial sobre capítulo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Legal case brought by members of the Augustinian order to remove the "provincial" from his office. The members of the order alleged the provincial extended his term of office by false means, was too old and sick to continue in office, and was unable to conduct an inspection tour of the order's monasteries in Peru. The provincial was also accused of being a poor administrator and a despot.

did.unittitle: Lista de los toros famosos que causaron la ruina y desolación de la noble ciudad de Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two copies of a text decrying the people this writer of royalist sympathies believes are destroying Lima. The volume contains poetry (décimas), a dialogue, and a list which describes prominent citizens of Lima as bulls or other participants in a bullfight.

did.unittitle: "Expediente comprensivo de la acta celebrada en junta de tribunales presidida por el exmo. Señor virrey sobre la continuación de los arbitrios que se entablaron en el año pasado de 1815 y adoptación de otros nuebos para socorro de las vigencias del erareo...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Document dealing with new taxes, enacted by a conclave of Lima's principal citizens, to help raise funds for defense against the revolt.

did.unittitle: "Recurso hecho por el marqués de Casares y presentado al ylustrísimo Señor arzobispo solicitando dispenza para contraer segundas nupcias con la hermana de su finada esposa."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Appeal made by the marquis of Caceres, to the archbishop of Lima, to grant a dispensation so that the marquis could marry his sister-in-law, Isabel Panizo. The appeal is grounded in religious law and personal arguments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten copy of a poem praising the riches of the Americas, and lamenting 300 years of Spanish rule.

did.unittitle: Expediente del gasto mensal del exército, marina y demás del estado político y medio de llenarlo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Detailed plan by the treasury to pay the salaries of the military and government officials, pensions, and other expenses. The plan included official pay cuts and voluntary concessions. Included are detailed tables listing salaries for different branches of the government, pensions, and other expenses.

did.unittitle: "Observaciones sobre una constitución religiosa considerada como parte de la civil nacional...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten copy of a "religious constitution" of forty one articles, designed for the nations of the Americas by Juan Antonio Llorente, a noted critic of the Spanish Inquisition. This constitution was designed to limit the power of the church. Every article is followed by the commentary of the unknown writer, who is only identified as a missionary of the colegio [-----zeloso] of the religion and a lover of the happiness of Peru. Text concludes with a section of general observations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sentences pronounced in a criminal case against a number of individuals implicated in a plot to kill SimÃ"n BolÃ­var. Most sentences were reduced in a review made one month later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two items written by José MarÃ­a Pando, who served as SimÃ"n BolÃ­var's minister of government in Peru. The first piece praises SimÃ"n BolÃ­var, and refutes accusations of dictatorship made against him in the paper Mensagero Argentino. The second deals with a proposed Peru-Bolivia confederation. The article discusses the potential impediments to such a federation, and what benefits Bolivia would gain by joining Peru.

did.unittitle: "Ensayo sobre la política del General Bolívar."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Text, written by an unidentified Peruvian author, which argues that SimÃ"n BolÃ­var is a foreigner who runs a despotic military government. The text details the series of events that led to the author's conclusion.

did.unittitle: Two letters. Places: Caracas and Cochabamba.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescript copies of two letters addressed to General AgustÃ­n Gamarra. The first is from SimÃ"n BolÃ­var thanking Gamarra for informing him of Cuzco's support for BolÃ­var's constitution. The second is signed by José Antonio Sucre and discusses their respective health and the state of affairs in Bolivia and Peru.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten extract from the periodical Buende lamenting BolÃ­var's governance of Peru. The article is especially critical of the constitution designed by BolÃ­var.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter addressed to RamÃ"n Ugarte dealing with the arrests of several military officers and the threat to public order.

did.unittitle: "Sermon disparado para la noche de navidad."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sermon delivered by Mariano Oyague in the home of Felipe Reyes. A subtitle reads, "y por tanto se decreta por siempre jamás amen que le laberinto de Creta sin licencia no se meta en el portal de Belén."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A notebook of different texts kept by an unknown individual. The texts include: "Discovery of America and the Murder of Pizarro;" a listing of earthquakes from the year 34 A.D. through 1729 A.D. in Asia and Europe; a description of the earthquake that destroyed Lisbon, Portugal, in 1755; listings of earthquakes in the Americas between 1586 and 1832; and a brief passage dealing with the secularization of the Carmelite nuns of Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies of the first and second issues of this newspaper, printed at the government press administered by P. Evaristo González. The articles are related to military affairs.

did.unittitle: Al Sr. Secretario del Excmo. Consejo de Estado.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed broadside written by San Roman, one the leading political figures of the era, on board the ship Venus, appealing his banishment from Peru because of conspiracy against the government.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Text written by an unknown [Peruvian?] author describing places in South America and the old Kingdom of Peru that were as rich, or richer, than California in mineral wealth. The text discusses gold, silver, iron, copper, other metals, mercury, precious stones, pearls, and corals.

did.unittitle: Ripart-Montclar Correspondence. Places: Lima, Vera Cruz, Paris, Guayaquil, Panama, Paita, Iquique, Santiago, Tarma, Montivideo, Buenos Aires, Caracas, Geneva, Lausanne, Berne.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal and professional correspondence (incoming and outgoing and including correspondence of others) of a nobleman and diplomat who served as France's secretary of the legation in Mexico, chargé d'affaires in Peru and Uruguay, minister to Venezuela, and ambassador to Switzerland. The majority of the correspondence dates to the Ripart-Montclar's service as French chargé d'affaires in Peru. Included are sixty one letters written to Ripart-Montclar's sister Marie-Thérèse, some of which are very detailed. There are seventy nine other letters mainly related to his diplomatic career. Some of these letters were written by: the French counsel in Vera Cruz, Mexico; Mr. Blacker, the French and English counsel in Paita, Peru; the wife of railroad builder Henry Meigs; Mr. Bunsen, the German chargé d'affaires in Lima; and Joseph Chesrey Rosseau, the French counsel in Panama.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten text in Latin discussing yellow fever.

did.unittitle: Anibel Maúrtua correspondence. Places: Lima and Tacna.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A series of three letters addressed to Anibel Maúrtua, either thanking him for copies of an article or seeking his assistance. One of the letters is written on official stationery and signed by President Eduardo LÃ"pez de Romaña.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten notebook listing "Spanish American books." Colonel George Earl Church recommended them to Hiram Bingham, to assist him in putting together "a useful collection of South American books."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter concerning Pérez de Velasco's library, which had been sold to Yale University. Attached is a five page index of letters that were part of the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter offering a copy of the author's book to the Yale University Library.

did.unittitle: Royal decrees. Places: Santo Domingo, Caracas, and Madrid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A series of royal decrees to the audiencia in Santo Domingo, and the governor of Venezuela, concerning church, governmental, and Indian affairs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Passport issued by the king granting permission for Joseph Antonio Moran's "lancha" San Francisco Javier to sail from La Guaira to and from the valleys of Zepe, Chuao, and Cata to trade.

did.unittitle: Alderson South American letters scrapbook. Places: Caracas, Valencia, New York, Bogotá, Bucaramanga, Soldedad, Baranquilla, Santa Marta.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook containing a wide variety of documents including, reports about the Comunero revolt, correspondence relating to Venezuela's independence, and letters written by a number of independence leaders and politicians of Colombia and Venezuela which date to the post-independence period.

did.unittitle: "Testimonio de la segunda pieza de los autos formados sobre la aprehensión del contrabando...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents related to the seizure of contraband merchandise on the brigantine La Casualidad. Included is a determination of the origin of the goods, and a valuation of the contraband.

did.unittitle: "Report on the deplorable state of Venezuela."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report written for the king by a former bishop of Caracas concerning the province's agriculture. The text concentrates on the difficulties confronting cacao growers, including low prices, difficulty shipping the product, as well as problems with merchants and shipowners. The report offers some recommendations to the king to help remedy the situation.

did.unittitle: "Artículos de la circular dirijida por el ministro colonial de la Gran Bretaña a los gefes de los Antillas Ynglesas."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Document, signed by SimÃ"n BolÃ­var, stating that the British had no reason to support the Spanish monarchy, and should not try to mediate between Spain and her colonies.

did.unittitle: Simón Bolívar correspondence. Places: Angostura, Maturín, San Cristóbal, Lima, La Laguna de las Laureles, Barinas, Trujillo, Guayaquil.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of twelve original letters written by SimÃ"n BolÃ­var, the liberator of South America. Subjects discussed include personal matters, military affairs, foreign relations, and political affairs. Eight letters are addressed to Guillermo (William) White, an English friend of BolÃ­var.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter by an independence leader to Guillermo White, discussing the military situation in Venezuela.

did.unittitle: Francisco Ribas correspondence. Places: Buenos Aires, Angostura, Bogotá, Caracas, La Guaira, Cumaná, Santiago, Paris, Calais, Barcelona, Valencia, La Trinidad, Maracuy, London, Curaçao, San Tomás, Le Havre, Talca, Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fifty eight letters of personal and professional correspondence (incoming and outgoing and including correspondence of others) of Francisco José de Ribas Galindo. These include letters from men who earlier had been active in the South American wars of independence, in particular Colombia and Venezuela, and in Chile. Most correspondence dates to the late or post independence periods when the writers had become politicians, diplomats, scholars or educators, exiles, or retirees.

did.unittitle: Francisco Ribas correspondence. Places: Buenos Aires, Angostura, Bogotá, Caracas, La Guaira, Cumaná, Santiago, Paris, Calais, Barcelona, Valencia, La Trinidad, Maracuy, London, Curaçao, San Tomás, Le Havre, Talca, Lima.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fifty eight letters of personal and professional correspondence (incoming and outgoing and including correspondence of others) of Francisco José de Ribas Galindo. These include letters from men who earlier had been active in the South American wars of independence, in particular Colombia and Venezuela, and in Chile. Most correspondence dates to the late or post independence periods when the writers had become politicians, diplomats, scholars or educators, exiles, or retirees.

did.unittitle: Two letters by Francisco José Lopez.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two personal letters written to Narcisco LÃ"pez, a Venezuela born Spanish military officer who plotted against Spanish rule in Cuba, by a brother or cousin. One letter contains the writer's views on contemporary Venezuelan society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A group of three letters written by Ana Paula LÃ"pez to her son, Narciso LÃ"pez. These letters concern personal matters and were written while Narciso was in exile in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One letter is to his uncle, Narciso LÃ"pez, concerning his upcoming marriage; the other letter is to his wife, Rosa, concerning his delay in returning to Caracas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A letter, written in English, by the independence leader, and later dictator of, Venezuela. The letter is written to an unknown party concerning an autograph and portrait.

did.unittitle: "Le Traité d'Amitié entre la France et le Vénézuéla."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Text written in French discussing a recently signed treaty of friendship; the state of French-Venezuelan relations; and Venezuela under the government of Antonio Guzmán Blanco.

did.unittitle: Photo album. Places: Dadajuro, Punta-de-Leiva, Miramar, El Amadre, Agua Viva, San Berjadin, Capaterida, La Dante, Mancunare, Manete. El Mene, La Rosa, Estancada, Puerto Rico and Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Album containing 486 black and white photographs and postcards. The photos belong to an unknown person who provided written identification of some of them. Many photos document the early days of the oil industry in Venezuela (1923-1925). The photos show individuals, different villages and camps, transportation, machinery and equipment, oil rigs, working conditions and scenes from daily life. Photos of Puerto Rico appear to be related to a pleasure trip of some type. The Mexican photos document oil exploration in 1920, daily life, Mexico City and a bullfight.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: These materials available on microfilm. Patrons must use FILM HM 247 instead of the originals.

did.unittitle: "Suceso portentoso acaecido en el asiento mineral de Porco distrito de Potosí."
"Sylva funebre a las honras del exclentissimo señor..."
"Plan que demuestra la superficie de la real mina de azogues de S.M. del cerro de Santa Bárbara de Huancavelica...."
"Plan de valance corte y tanteo de la moneda fysyca y alajas de plata y oro en especye pertenecyentes a las temporalidades del reyno de Peru...."
"Estado general de los empleados en este virreynato, que siendo de absoluta nominación de S.M. por llegar y exceder sus sueldos de la suma de 400"
"Adicción al capítulo 17 del libro 2? de 2? parte de los Comentarios Reales del Peru de Garcilaso de la Vega."
"Padrón del pueblo del Callao y del de Pitipiti...."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of published illustrated materials related to the war with Spain, the Chilean Civil War, the War of the Pacific, as well as illustrations of Chilean city scenes, and the Guano Islands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of late twentieth-century imprints on various trade unions in Venezuela. The bulk of the materials comes from the period between 1980 and 1995. Trade unions represented in this collection include Confederación de Trabajadores de Venezueula (CTV), Federación de Trabajadores de Venezuela, and Comité por la Defensa del Salario (CDS). Materials include contracts, position papers (including working papers), press releases, copies of newspaper articles and other official union documents.

did.unittitle: Broadside: Agustín de Jáuregui y Aldecoa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of printed copies of email correspondence compiled by Yale Professor Enrique Mayer compiled during the early days of email listservs in the 1990s. The messages were posted on listservs and discussion boards that focused on the political situation of Peru during this time period by Peruvians living in the United States.
